column4: Im having trouble getting the system to boot a current kernel. Ive booted up 2.6.12-9, which seems to be the last working kernel (but several others that wont boot).
hrm :(
I need help with booting. boots older kernel, but not new ones.
am I just typing to myself?
do u have those kernels installed?
yes, i have several kernels that wont boot :( one that does.
do u have them in your grub menu.lst file?
yeah...
looking over /boot/grub/menu.lst ...
is there any error messages, does it hand or what?
when u hit esc on grub boot phase do u see the menu with boot options?
Ive tried a couple of the newwer kernels, and they dont always lock up in the same place. often its near the beginning (mounting file systems and stuffl)...
oh ok
well u really gotta look at the logs see whats happening there
I looked over menu.lst, didnt see anything odd..
my guess is there isnt any log entries as it usually doesnt get too far in the boot process...
well i dunno, i doesnt issue no kernel panic no nothing huh?
usually it just locks up with the boot process on the screen... often within the first few tasks...
they always load the kernel, and the ubuntu boot up screen...
and the only keyboard I have I use on another computer :( (I use synergy with several computers, 1 keyboard).
it looks like a DMA problem ? Im not sure how I can have a DMA problem with one kernel, but not another ?
my issue seems to be DMA, adding ide=nodma has the system booting. not sure why though...
